alert.note: Alert for Central Colorado River Basin; Debeque to Silt Corridor; Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; Grand Valley; Grand and Battlement Mesas; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 23 at 10:50PM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW BAND... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. This band of heavy snow is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 1049 PM MST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of New Castle to Moab and moving north at 5 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Grand Junction, Glenwood Springs, Moab, Castle Valley, Fruita, Rifle, New Castle, Silt, Palisade, Parachute, Collbran, De Beque, Spanish Valley, Mesa, Rio Blanco, Battlement Mesa, Cameo, Molina, Arches National Park and Glade Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 120. Interstate 70 in Utah between mile markers 197 and 224. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 41. U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 118 and 149. Utah 128 between mile markers 0 and 44. Utah 279 between mile markers 10 and 15. Utah 313 near mile marker 22. Colorado 13 between mile markers 1 and 19. Colorado 65 between mile markers 48 and 61. Colorado 82 near mile marker 1. Colorado 139 between mile markers 1 and 9. Colorado 141 between mile markers 120 and 121, and between mile markers 154 and 162. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
